column3: I teach students that what people say about failure in politics is mostly wrong. People always told me, 'They'll praise you on your way up and kick you on your way down.' That wasn't my experience. I can't walk down the street in Toronto without someone coming up and saying hello.
Most leadership strategies are doomed to failure from the outset.

I think that Obama's failure to reestablish the rule of law in money matters is the most damaging thing that he's done - and perhaps the most damaging thing that has happened in American politics in my lifetime. Because once the rule of law is absent in money matters, then anything really goes in politics.
I think if you look at the failure of journalism in the modern age, then I don't want to be called a journalist.

I firmly believe that unless one has tasted the bitter pill of failure, one cannot aspire enough for success.

Optimism is a kind of heart stimulant - the digitalis of failure.

Rinse, wash and repeat.
